intro: Pseudocyclosorus medogensis, commonly known as the Medog fern, is a rare and unique species native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, leathery fronds that are typically divided into small, lance-shaped segments. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its reproductive structures, including spore-bearing sorus, are clustered on the underside of the fronds, a common feature among ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
